newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS - Volatility trades struck in UK shares.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS - Volatility trades struck in UK shares.

text.p: Volatility trades in mining group Rio Tinto and in engineer LucasVarity were among the main UK stock options trades on Monday, dealers said.

In Rio Tinto, a long strangle was established by buying 500 November 1100 puts at 38p as well as 500 November 1150 calls at 35p. For a profit, the underlying shares need to be volatile and if the position is held to expiry, the shares must either go below 1027p or above 1223p.
By 1505 GMT, Rio Tinto shares were down 4p to 1009p.
In LucasVarity, a long straddle was established by buying 250 November 200 puts and calls at 16p and 10-1/2p each.
For a profit at expiry, the shares need to either go below 173-1/2p or above 226-1/2p.

The biggest deal in pharmaceuticals group Glaxo Wellcome was the rolling forward of a long position involving the sale of 500 July 1300 calls at 41p -- in a closing deal -- and the purchase of 500 October 1300 calls at 87p.
And in British Aerospace, one trader bought put options to hedge against possible losses on a shareholding in the company.
The deal was to buy 500 November 1350 puts at prices of 75p and 77p against buying British Aerospace shares at 1320p.

In general if the shares fall, the puts can be exercised to sell 1/2-million shares at 1350p each. And if the shares rally, profits from the shareholding will be reduced by the cost of the puts. British Aerospace shares gained 11p to 1336p.
In index options, the main deals were the rolling forward of positions ahead of Friday's expiry of FTSE 100 index options and call spreads bought against futures in volatility trades.
